intro: Mimosa berroi, commonly known as the pink mimosa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its bipinnate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces small, spherical pods that contain several seeds, typical of its legume family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Mimosa berroi is also known for its sensitive leaves that fold when touched, a trait shared with other mimosa species.
